body:
Comment 3: 
tubenose=% cat x.go
package main

import (
	"fmt";
	"regexp"
)

func main() {
	re := regexp.MustCompile(`^/$`);
	fmt.Printf("%#v\n", re.MatchStrings("/css"));
}
tubenose=% 6g x.go
tubenose=% 6l x.6
tubenose=% 6.out
[]string{}
tubenose=% 

works fine for me with current build. i've tried it on linux and mac with amd64.

/ is not a special character so that's not it.

i also synced to where you saw the trouble and again saw correct behavior.  closing 
for now; if it reappears please send a complete program that fails.
_Status changed to **Invalid**._
